Name: Project:EagleBeak
About the game: The Matrix Laboratory is part of the Project:EagleBeak, established in 1990 by a mysterious civilian organization of several superpowers using the technological power of the U.S.S.R. space program and has been kept secretly updated and maintained. The matrix laboratory is connected in all directions, consisting of numerous layers of small and large square cabin, each layer has a square cabin to provide a 'key', another square cabin to provide an 'exit', get the key to find the exit can enter the deeper level of the square cabin, each deep layer, the matrix of The number of matrices will increase. The game provides elements of combat, strategy, and puzzle solving, so players can choose their own way to play. The game randomly builds matrices on each level, and gradually adds more difficult and scary cubicle rooms as your ability rises. For example, you can flexibly use a wide variety of 'function cards' to avoid the risky pods and directly find the key to the next level. You can also build up your strength to upgrade yourself to accept the challenges and battles in each room, and finally break into the next level. There are 5 types of rooms in Matrix Lab, namely 'Battle', 'Danger', 'Safety', 'Restricted ', 'empty', they will be randomly combined to create an infinite variety of levels, use your wisdom and strength to escape from here. The game also provides an additional 75 clues that can be explored and discovered in repeated playthroughs, and collecting them will give you a full picture of the story of Project:EagleBeak.
